intro: Asperula pestalozzae, commonly known as the Pestalozza's woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Asperula pestalozzae is often found in woodland edges and rocky soils, thriving in partial shade and well-drained conditions.
